Description: Rim and neck sherd of large South Ionian Wild Goat style pottery krater; interior: wide black band at rim, reserved below; on top of rim, zig-zag with 'T's in interstices between pairs of lines; outside of rim reserved; exterior, cream slip; panel on neck with meander and square-pattern and bands of billet-and-dot above and below.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd referred to by Cook and published in CVA Oxford II, pl. VI, no. 4 is not this neck sherd.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.017)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
